benchmark_details.name: BAMBOO: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Evaluating Long Text Modeling Capacities of Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: BAMBOO is a multi-task long context benchmark designed to evaluate the long text modeling capabilities of large language models (LLMs) through ten datasets across five distinct tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation platform for assessing the long text capabilities of large language models.

data.source: Ten datasets manually constructed from various sources including NLP research papers, government reports, and TV show transcripts.
data.size: 3,004 examples (1,502 in each of the two subsets)
data.annotation: Constructed through manual labeling by experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on different tasks designed for precision and reliability in evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on the capability to accurately complete tasks involving long texts.
methodology.baseline_results: Results of various long-context LLMs were compared against random baselines across tasks.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation through evaluation of several widely-used long-context models.
